availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Quiggins (Hardin County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Elizabethtown, Kentucky, native. Son of John Quiggins and Phoebe Tull Quiggins. Carpenter in Hardin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private and corporal from June 13, 1861, to May 13, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Northern District, p. 308B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown, p. 323A.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0078.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 21646.
